item.title: Calibration, Net Re-Classification Index and Goodness-of-Fit Test for Logistic Regression
item.description: This post shows how to calculate the Net Re-Classification Index and Goodness-of-Fit Test (Hosmer-Lemeshow Test) for logistic regression models. In addition, we show how to plot the calibration curves. # load packages ---------------------------------------------------------- if (!requireNamespace("pacman", quietly = TRUE)) { install.packages("pacman") } pacman::p_load(PredictABEL) pacman::p_load(aod) pacman::p_load(ggplot2) # packages for ggplot2 themes pacman::p_load(ggrepel) # colors and themes ------------------------------------------------------- # color blind palette cbbPalette <- c("#999999", "#E69F00", "#56B4E9", "#009E73", "#F0E442", "#0072B2", "#D55E00", "#CC79A7") # my theme defaults gg_sy <- theme(legend.

item.title: Variable Selection and Prediction in Competing Risk Regression
item.description: Objective The main goal of this post is to: Show one way of performing variable selection in a competing risks regression model Evaluate the predictive performance for a list of models using resampling methods What the data looks like We will use the bmtcrr dataset from the casebase package available on CRAN.
